docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Chord Progressions is a Python library of utility functions for working with chord progressions.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
The simplest way to create a Progression is with a list of chords specified in MIDI note numbers.

from chord_progressions import Progression
progression = Progression(chords=[[69, 84, 90, 99], [60, 67, 71, 87, 98]])

Each Chord in a Progression has the following attributes:

  • id: a UUID
  • ix: the index of the chord in the progression
  • type: the name of the chord, given by this list
  • typeId: a unique ID of the chord type
  • duration: specified in Tone.Time.Notation as one of ["8n", "4n", "4n.", "2n", "2n.", "1m", "2m"]
  • notes: the MIDI note names of the notes in the chord
  • metrics: a dictionary of attributes computed based on the notes in the chord

docs.title: Extract
docs.text: An API is provided to automatically extract chord progressions from audio and midi. These functions are experimental and the quality of the results may vary greatly between types of music.

docs.title: Extract chords from a midi file
Extract chords from an audio file
docs.text:
NOTE: this requires installing Essentia with Python bindings which is not included in this library.

from chord_progressions.extract import extract_progression_from_audio
progression = extract_progression_from_audio('my_file.wav')
